description: Enterprise techniques used by TRITON, ATT&CK software S0609 v1.0
name: TRITON (S0609)

techniques.comment: [TRITON](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0609) was run as trilog.exe, a Py2EXE compiled python script that accepts a single IP address as a flag.(Citation: FireEye TRITON 2017)
[TRITON](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0609) attempts to write a dummy program into memory if it fails to reset the Triconex controller.(Citation: FireEye TRITON 2017)
[TRITON](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0609) disguised itself as the legitimate Triconex Trilog application.(Citation: FireEye TRITON 2017)
[TRITON](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0609) encoded the two inject.bin and imain.bin payloads.(Citation: FireEye TRITON 2017)
[TRITON](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0609)’s TsLow python module pings controllers over the TriStation protocol.(Citation: FireEye TRITON 2017)
